intro: Scilla uluensis, commonly known as the Ulu Peninsula scilla, is a flowering plant native to the Ulu Peninsula in Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and forested areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it blooms in early spring. Scilla uluensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
